item.title: xAI lays out interplanetary ambitions in public all-hands
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: On Wednesday, xAI took the rare step of publishing its full 45-minute all-hands presentation to the X platform, making it widely available.

item.title: AI inference startup Modal Labs in talks to raise at $2.5B valuation, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: General Catalyst is in talks to lead the round for the four-year-old startup, according to our sources.

item.title: OpenAI disbands mission alignment team
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The team's leader has been given a new role as OpenAI's chief futurist, while the other team members have been reassigned throughout the company.

item.title: Apple’s Siri revamp reportedly delayed… again
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: While the new Siri was expected to launch with the upcoming iOS 26.4 update in March, now, the changes are expected to roll out more slowly over time, reportedly postponing some features until the May iOS update, or even until the release of iOS 27 in September.

item.title: Uber Eats launches AI assistant to help with grocery cart creation
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Uber Eats launched a new AI feature, “Cart Assistant,” that can automatically add items to your cart based on text or image prompts.

item.title: Glean’s fight to own the AI layer inside every company
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Enterprise AI is shifting fast from chatbots that answer questions to systems that actually do the work across an organization. But who will own the AI layer that powers all of it?  Glean, which started as an enterprise search product, has evolved into what it calls an “AI work assistant,” aiming to sit beneath other AI […]

item.title: Who will own your company’s AI layer? Glean’s CEO explains
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Enterprise AI is shifting fast from chatbots that answer questions to systems that actually do the work across an organization. But who will own the AI layer that powers all of it?  Glean, which started as an enterprise search product, has evolved into what it calls an “AI work assistant,” aiming to sit underneath other AI […]

item.title: Elon Musk suggests spate of xAI exits have been push, not pull
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: At least nine engineers, including two co-founders, have announced their exits from xAI in the past week, fueling online speculation and raising questions about stability at Musk’s AI company amid mounting controversy.

item.title: Why the economics of orbital AI are so brutal
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: A 1 GW orbital data center would cost roughly $42.4 billion — almost three times its ground-bound equivalent.

item.title: Threads’ new ‘Dear Algo’ AI feature lets you personalize your feed
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The platform's new feature lets users tell Threads what they temporarily want to see more or less of in their feed.

item.title: How AI changes the math for startups, according to a Microsoft VP
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Amanda Silver is a corporate vice president at Microsoft’s CoreAI division, where she works on tools for deploying apps and agentic systems within enterprises.

item.title: Former Founders Fund VC Sam Blond launches AI sales startup to upend Salesforce
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The startup, Monaco, has come out of stealth as an AI-native all-in-one CRM plus more system backed by names like the Collison brothers and Garry Tan.

item.title: Build a pipeline and close deals with an exhibit table at TechCrunch Disrupt 2026
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Get an unmatched ROI by exhibiting your startup in front of 10,000 tech leaders and investors at TechCrunch Disrupt 2026, October 13-15 in San Francisco. Book your table now before it's gone.

item.title: Meridian raises $17 million to remake the agentic spreadsheet
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: A new company called Meridian.AI has emerged from stealth with an IDE-based approach to agentic financial modeling.

item.title: With co-founders leaving and an IPO looming, Elon Musk turns talk to the moon
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: According to The New York Times, which reports that it heard the meeting, Musk told employees that xAI needs a lunar manufacturing facility, a factory on the moon that will build AI satellites and fling them into space via a giant catapult.

item.title: OpenAI policy exec who opposed chatbot’s ‘adult mode’ reportedly fired on discrimination claim
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The executive has denied the allegation that she engaged in discrimination.

item.title: Okay, now exactly half of xAI’s founding team has left the company
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Whatever the cause of the departures, the cumulative impact is alarming. There is a lot of work left to do at xAI, and an IPO will bring more scrutiny than the lab has ever faced before.

item.title: Amazon may launch a marketplace where media sites can sell their content to AI companies
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: A new report claims the e-commerce giant is looking to create a pipeline of licensable content between media publishers and AI companies.

item.title: An ice dance duo skated to AI music at the Olympics
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Czech ice dancers Katerina Mrazkova and Daniel Mrazek are learning the hard way that LLMs sometimes spit out straight-up plagiarism.

item.title: This Sequoia-backed lab thinks the brain is ‘the floor, not the ceiling’ for AI
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AI lab Flapping Airplanes just landed $180 million in seed funding from the likes of Google Ventures, Sequoia, and Index to do something most labs have quietly given up on: making models learn like humans instead of vacuuming up the internet. The founding team, made up of brothers Ben and Asher Spector and co-founder Aidan Smith, is […]
